Like I said, it's a bad copy of the game by iMARS. I read that it may work if you have an iHas burner otherwise don't waste your time downloading cause there is a 99% chance you'll get a disc unreadable error within 10 mins of starting the game. Hopefully someone else releases a better copy soon.

this will only work if you don't truncate and IF YOU HAVE iHas Burner

iMARS confirmed that this game has extra protection like serious sam 3

Note: It seems that this game has some extra protection and truncated burns are not working. If you truncate/overburn this game it will stop working at around 5 minutes of gameplay and will show you an error.

You’ll have to use a Liteon IHAS burner to burn this game + use good quality dvds ( verbatim are recommended).

This is what i have seen till now

JTAG & RGH = Game works fine

LT+ 3.0 & 2.0 with IHAS drive = Game works fine

LT+ 3.0 & 2.0 without IHAS (truncating or overburning) = Game stops working after 5-10 minutes

X360key & Wasabi = No reports yet.
Guys, if you are burning this game as truncate, change the layerbreak to 2086912, people are reporting this to work

No this game haven’t any new security checks. Jus got an upgraded LiteOn iHas 124b to a 524b flashed wiv iXtreme 4 £40 - is that gd?

@jamesfludgate /you paid £40,i bought a liteon-ihas 124-xx-b for £15 off of amazon thats a baseline model i only use it for burning xgd3 and anything else,£40 is quite expensive imo,if it's just for xgd3 backups etc.

I use a sata cable and a usb and a molex power brick to power the liteon-ihas drive here r the link were you can get them and what they look like
http://www.amazon.co.uk/Wired-Up-SATA-Power-Adapter-Cable/dp/B000ITL1PG/ref=pd_rhf_cr_shvl1
http://www.modtraders.co.uk/12v-dc-4_pin-molex-external_power-supply-adapter.html
(I use my x360usb-pro to connect my sata to-usb-molex power supply thats how i do it.)it's really very easy and cheap in the long run.

to power the liteon-ihas 124-xx-b you need 1st
http://www.modtraders.co.uk/12v-dc-4_pin-molex-external_power-supply-adapter.html
and 2nd
http://www.amazon.co.uk/Wired-Up-SATA-Power-Adapter-Cable/dp/B000ITL1PG/ref=pd_rhf_cr_shvl1
and 3rd a way to connect them to your pc i use my x360usb-pro because its handy and does the job,thats it,thats all you need to burn 100% of the data on xgd3 8.14gb disc's,truncating them is just to risky as you only copy 97% of the data on the iso which will get you banned on live.hope this helps you all out
